title: Michael B Jordan Discusses TV Adaptation of Fourth Wing with Focus on Authentic Casting
summary: Michael B Jordan, an actor and producer, is developing a TV adaptation of the best-selling fantasy book Fourth Wing through his company Outlier Society in partnership with Amazon. He emphasizes that the show, which features dragons, magic, warfare, and romance, will avoid being cheesy and will not rely on obvious casting choices. Jordan aims to balance new and well-known actors to prevent distractions and allow viewers to connect with characters as imagined in the books. He acknowledges the importance of casting for the Empyrean series, which includes multiple books, and notes the potential for a deep cast. Speaking at the Academy Awards luncheon in Los Angeles, where his film Sinners received numerous nominations, Jordan also discusses his expanding career into producing and directing, including projects like The Thomas Crown Affair remake. He hints at possibly acting in the series but remains uncertain, focusing on creating an honest adaptation.

background_read: Fourth Wing is a fantasy novel by Rebecca Yarros that has gained global popularity, selling millions of copies in 40 languages. It is the first book in the Empyrean series, which includes themes of dragons, magic, and romance. Michael B Jordan is a renowned actor known for roles in films like Black Panther and Creed, and he has recently expanded into producing and directing through his company Outlier Society. This article highlights his efforts to adapt the book into a TV series with Amazon, focusing on authentic casting to honor the source material. It also touches on his current Oscar nomination for Sinners and his broader career ambitions in the entertainment industry.
Article_Structure: Main Points: Michael B Jordan is developing a TV adaptation of Fourth Wing, emphasizing non-cheesy, authentic casting with a mix of new and known actors to connect viewers to the book's characters. Purpose: To inform about the adaptation process and Jordan's creative vision, promoting excitement for the show.
